Package org.factcenter.qilin.protocols

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    BulkOT
    An interface for performing more efficient OTs in a batch.
    BulkOT.Receiver  
    BulkOT.Sender  
    BulkOT.SplitReceiver
    An interface that allows the user to split the writing and reading phases of the receive operation.
    BulkOT.SplitReceiver.State  
    BulkOT.SplitSender
    An interface that allows the user to split the writing and reading phases of the send operation.
    BulkOT.SplitSender.State  
    CommitmentPoK
    A Zero-Knowledge Proof-of-Knowledge for a committed value in a non-interactive commitment scheme.
    CommitmentPoK.Prover<C,P,R>
    Represents the Prover in the Zero-Knowledge Proof-of-Knowledge of a Commitment.
    CommitmentPoK.Verifier<C,P,R>
    Represents the Verifier in the Zero-Knowledge Proof-of-Knowledge of a Commitment.
    OT1of2
    Interface for 1-out-of-2 string Oblivious Transfer (OT).
    OT1of2.Chooser
    Represents the Chooser in a 1-out-of-2 string OT
    OT1of2.Sender
    Represents the Sender in a 1-out-of-2 string OT.
    OTExtender
    A convenience interface to capture all the APIs that must be implemented by an OT Extender.
    ProtocolParty
    A ProtocolParty defines the basic functions every participant in a protocol should implement.
    SigmaProtocol
    A Sigma protocol is a three-move proof protocol with a specific structure: The prover commits The verifier sends a challenge. The prover responds to the challenge
    SigmaProtocol.Prover<Params>
    An interface for a prover in a sigma protocol.
    SigmaProtocol.Verifier<Params>
    An interface for the verifier in a sigma protocol.
    TrapdoorCommitmentPoK
    This is a version of a commitment Proof-of-Knowledge in which there exists a trapdoor for the prover.
    TrapdoorCommitmentPoK.TrapdoorProver<C,P,R>
    Represents a prover holding the secret trapdoor key for the proof-of-knowledge.
    TrapdoorTwoPartyGroupElementFlip
    A coin-flip for group elements where one of the parties may be able to use a trapdoor.
    TrapdoorTwoPartyGroupElementFlip.TrapdoorFirst<G>
    Represents a party holding a trapdoor key for the group-element flipping protocol.
    TwoPartyGroupElementFlip
    Coin flip for group elements (the result is a random group element).
    TwoPartyGroupElementFlip.First<G>
    Interface for the "first" party in the two party protocol.
    TwoPartyGroupElementFlip.Second<G>
    Interface for the "second" party in the two party protocol.
  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    CheatingPeerException
    This exception is thrown by a protocol party that detects cheating by its peer.
